readability_reflection: When it has variables at the beginning, you check the placements of those first before starting at the beginning of the answers to get rid of wrong answers. For instance if Peter was supposed to be the first output, then the others would be deducted out.
comprehension_debugging: Interpolation was harder for me personally, but I have more experience on concatenation. Especially when there are both ("") and ({}} in the same statement.
preference_rationale: String concatenation, simply for readability and prior experience.
learning_curve: The ability to read it without second guessing or re-reading the code. I would often re-read and then end up with a different answer and it causes confusion which one I believed was right.
